This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10284~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7817032756/job/21323961969)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7817032756/job/21323962295)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7817032756/job/21323962881)

I'm hopping back and forth... on the one hand shorter names good, on the other hand primed-names less good...
```suggestion
theorem isUnit_of_mul_eq_one_right [CommMonoid M] (a b : M) (h : a * b = 1) : IsUnit b := by
```
Please also add the claim about polynomial expressions.
To be clear, this is not a `TODO` because the existence theorem includes the condition `s âˆˆ adjoin K {f}` (likewise `n`). I have added a sentence to doc strings stating this explicitly.

I think I would prefer a separate variable instead of `f - s`.
The statement would become a bit longer, but when used with `obtain` the `f = N + s` clause can often be deconstructed using `rfl`, and the resulting goal state in applications might be closer to what the user wants.

OK done.

What you propose also has the advantage that it saves the user having to prove that nilpotent part is a also a polynomial in `f` (if they want this).

FWIW if / when we add the uniqueness my plan would be to add some API that obviates the need to use these lemmas directly along the lines of:
```lean
def semisimpleComponent [PerfectField K] : End K V := ...

def nilpotentComponent [PerfectField K] : End K V := ...
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add proof of Jordan-Chevalley-Dunford decomposition
